body:
Tony died

So on the 25th of May this year (2019) my dad surprised me and got me a hamster because I’ve been wanting one. I had done research and made an entire PowerPoint presentation to convince my parents to let me get one. I got the hamster back home and decided to honor iron Man and named my hamster Tony Stark. I loved this little guy and was taking care of him. According to where I got him, he was 3 weeks old. I thought I had a few years with him because they don’t live that long but no. Six days after getting him he dies. It was very sudden, too. I woke up, checked on him, fed him and he was running around and nothing seemed wrong. I didn’t have anywhere to go for the day so I went back to bed and 3 hours later I decide to get up for the day. I go to check on him because he is usually up at this point and I find out he’s dead. I’m balling by this point because I had just got him hand trained and we had bonded. I had made videos about him and I’m still upset. And now I can’t stop thinking about how no Tony Stark is apparently allowed in my life this year and it sucks.

Natasha, a desperate mom: Food.
Tony: Dating.
Nebula: Murder.

Natasha, a desperate mom: Food.

tags: i know younger people joke about parents holding on to their fave stuff
and wanting their children to watch it with them
but this is why they do it
so long as we remember he isn't dead
look at the star trek fandom.
it's still going strong. even for tos.
if we want rdj's tony to remain alive
then we have to keep the fandom going
summary: Do think the love for Tony stark and Ironman is going to slowly die down now that he's going to be in any more movies.
question: Do think the love for Tony stark and Ironman is going to slowly die down now that he's going to be in any more movies.
answer:
No, not immediately. The love will continue for a few more years, possibly up to a decade, without any decline. After that, it’s up to both Marvel and us - without new content, those just growing up or going to college or getting out on their own will not have the option of being introduced to Iron Man through media. That means we’ll have to be the ones to continue talking about him.

Honestly, with how well the movies were done (I’m talking Iron Man and Iron Man 2 and The Avengers), we can hope to continue seeing some life for a while. Remember Batman Begins and its subsequent movies? Those ended in 2012, yet people still make Bane references. People still love Batman Begins, even though it came out in 2005. We have a real chance of keeping Iron Man alive. We just have to keep talking about him.

As for long term… whenever you have the extra time, money, or desire, and you want to have kids… consider buying Avengers Assemble, the Iron Man TV shows, and anything else that you love. Growing up, I came to love the old Superman movies and Batman movies (and the 60′s TV show, lol) and even The Indian and the Cupboard, along with several other books and movies, because my parents had them and sat and watched them with me. It was a bonding moment and a chance to fall in love with the movies and characters, all in one. That can keep him alive for generations.

trail.content:
No, not immediately. The love will continue for a few more years, possibly up to a decade, without any decline. After that, it’s up to both Marvel and us - without new content, those just growing up or going to college or getting out on their own will not have the option of being introduced to Iron Man through media. That means we’ll have to be the ones to continue talking about him.

Honestly, with how well the movies were done (I’m talking Iron Man and Iron Man 2 and The Avengers), we can hope to continue seeing some life for a while. Remember Batman Begins and its subsequent movies? Those ended in 2012, yet people still make Bane references. People still love Batman Begins, even though it came out in 2005. We have a real chance of keeping Iron Man alive. We just have to keep talking about him.

As for long term… whenever you have the extra time, money, or desire, and you want to have kids… consider buying Avengers Assemble, the Iron Man TV shows, and anything else that you love. Growing up, I came to love the old Superman movies and Batman movies (and the 60′s TV show, lol) and even The Indian and the Cupboard, along with several other books and movies, because my parents had them and sat and watched them with me. It was a bonding moment and a chance to fall in love with the movies and characters, all in one. That can keep him alive for generations.

title: Slight Error of Judgement
body:
by Theavengingavengers

Tony and Steve get engaged! Except…of course nothing is ever that simple.

In which there is a misunderstanding, Natasha is frustrated, Fury is angry, Steve and Tony are self-destructive, and everyone else is trying to figure out what just happened.

Words: 4223, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers - Ambiguous Fandom
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark, Bruce Banner, Thor (Marvel), Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Clint Barton, Nick Fury
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark, Implied Bruce Banner/Thor
  • Additional Tags: Get Together, well kinda, re get together?, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, endgame who??? endgame what????, I’m so sad they cancelled the mcu after Avengers (2012), :////, it couldve been so much but alas, but hey now we can pretend that the team moved in with tony and lived happily ever after, except they are all dramatic and gay so thats unrealistic, Engagement, Domestic Avengers, Team as Family, Post-Avengers (2012), Avengers Family, Avengers Tower, they are all loving and supportive of each other, tony and steve are dumb and gay and STILL don’t know how to communicate properly, well what do u expect they’re all traumatized harold, Happy Ending, Angst with a Happy Ending, Canon Divergence - Avengers (2012)

read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2HTcdDT

by Theavengingavengers

Tony and Steve get engaged! Except…of course nothing is ever that simple.

In which there is a misunderstanding, Natasha is frustrated, Fury is angry, Steve and Tony are self-destructive, and everyone else is trying to figure out what just happened.

tony: i'm writing a list of everyone who likes me
stephen: but there are no names on you list
tony:...
body:
stephen: what are you doing?

tony: i’m writing a list of everyone who likes me

stephen: but there are no names on you list

tony: exactly

stephen: *angrily takes the list*

stephen: *angrily writes ‘stephen strange’ on that list*

stephen: *angrily kisses tony*

tony: *angrily shocked*

blog.name: i-love-you-10000
blog.title: I am Iron Man.
blog.description: Fra | She/Her | Kitty | Italy | Stony | I don't believe in MCU

summary: I had an incredible dream and it was about Tony Stark and Stony, so I’m proud of myself: there were my cousin and myself, and I...
body:
I had an incredible dream and it was about Tony Stark and Stony, so I’m proud of myself:

there were my cousin and myself, and I was explaining her who Tony Stark is. I remember we were watching him and Steve, that where looking at the holographic screens in the lab. Do you remember in Endgame, when the avengers were looking at all the dusted people on the screens? It was the same thing, but the faces where different, some of them where old and others were very young.

Then I don’t know how, someone else started telling the story about what we were looking at, and Howard Stark appeared.

It seems he sort of discovered how to manipulate the genes in the offsprings or something similar (hey, it was a dream) while trying to create the perfect human. He experimented with pregnant women, paying them to allow him to inject some formula, or whatever. I think my brain thought Howard was rich enough to “buy” those women and didn’t spend a lot of time on the experiments themselves. If somebody has watched Shadowhunter, they will understand where my brain found this idea. Anyway Howard let those women go on their ways, since he had to wait for the babies to grow up and didn’t want to have anything to do with them.

Then Steve Rogers happened, he created Captain America and stopped experimenting on the babies, since he considered Steve as the perfect human and soldier, just like he wanted. But as you know, Steve Rogers sacrificed himself… and Howard was alone again, without his creation.

He resumed his experiments, also with his own child, without letting Maria know about it. What he didn’t consider was that he would have to raise that child, because he was his own, not of other families. And when he couldn’t keep Anthony under his control, because he was too clever, too smart to simply follow other people’s rules without questioning them, we all know how well he raised him. He was cold and an alcoholic and this is only the start (Howard Stark A+ parenting)

Back to the future- remember when Howard told Tony he was his greatest creation? Yeah, he meant literally. His son was one of the successfully ended experiment, and Howard didn’t know how to be a father for a child, even less for an experiment.

The Stony part? I remember dreaming the OUAT catch phrase “I’ll always find you”. Yeah, my mind is a mix of fantasy series. Anyway, Steve had always seen Howard with those women, but he didn’t investigat, he had a lot of other things to do, I mean war, plus he trusted his friend and the women didn’t seem hurt or in danger, they even returned with their offsprings to meet Howard. Steve himself met some of the children too, when he was around, playing with them a little or something like this. When he asked questions, Howard always had good, satisfying answers.

Then Steve wake up ~70 years later, and he worked at SHIELD with the children or even the grandchildren of those babies. Good people, bad people, of every ethnicity and so on… he maybe noticed that they seemed to have something in common, like the way they talked or moved. I precisely remember a night scene on a deck(?)or a roof(?) somewhere high and open under the night sky, where Steve was talking with this FBI agent, good looking and smart, who was waving both hands a bit too much.

When Tony happened in Steve’s life, the soldier didn’t make a link among those people and the greatest genius, even if he couldn’t avoid to find some similarities in the back of his mind. Until they became a couple and Tony told him what Howard did (he discovered it in Iron Man 2 as said before) and they decided to track down all the people involved, because even if they weren’t half-brothers and half-sisters by blood, or half-cousins, they were artificially related.

And that’s when I return looking at Tony, Steve and at the screens again. All the faces were the people Tony was related to. The same people Howard experimented on, plus their own children and grandchildren. You can imagine my shock when I saw Rhodey’s face and… do you remember the little spider/genius? Yep, Peter’s face was also present.

It’s a bad thing, Steve knows it, a very terrific one… a man who experimented on women and babies, manipulating their genes(?? My dream, my rules) but at the same times, he finds it romantic in a twisted way, because that means he’s always been sorrounded by Tonys, since his first days as Cap. And he also found his own.

Okay, I swear it seemed more romantic when I first wake up this morning. I read a lot of posts saying that Tony and Steve are always a constant in all the universe, that there cannot be one without the other, and they always find each other eventually. So my brain came up with this,,,
body_abstract:

title: What if...
body: You had been one of Tony’s “students” along with Peter? After the snap, you lost your family, so he invited you to live with him, Pepper, and Morgan.

reblog.comment: You had been one of Tony’s “students” along with Peter? After the snap, you lost your family, so he invited you to live with him, Pepper, and Morgan.
